abstracts.cdata!:
The project is rated generally
            satisfactory. Project sustainability is likely. Both World
            Bank and Borrower performances were satisfactory. Lessons
            learned include the following: The provinces are capable of
            implementing education projects of this nature with the
            overall advice of a Chinese Experts Panel and the guidance
            and coordination of the Ministry of Education-Foreign
            Investment and Loan Office; however, institutional
            development in project management and supervision must be
            stressed in the project formulation. As in all past
            education projects, technical assistance and studies receive
            very little attention until the latter part of the project
            implementation period; consequently, their impact during the
            project implementation period is minimal. In this project
            there were additional difficulties whereby each of the six
            provinces were to jointly approve terms of reference,
            contracts, etc., and to make payments of the research group
            conducting the three studies funded by the project.
            Development of proper project indicators are essential for
            the monitoring of the project--both for the physical
            accomplishments as well as for the project benefits. IDA
            (International Development Association) should provide more
            supervision resources for such a geographically dispersed
            project as this and must ensure the proper implementation of
            all technical assistance activities early in the project
            implementation through proper use of conditions and covenants.
